page.title: 05CHANGING TIMES OF SEAFORD
page.content: DID YOU KNOW THAT SEAFORD USED TO BE A{HARBOUR ?}AND THAT THERE WAS A RIVER RUNNING DOWN{STEYNE ROAD ?}SEAFORD USED TO BE A{PORT}AND A{HARBOUR,}IT WAS GIVEN THE NAME{CINQUE PORT}BECAUSE IN THE 13TH CENTURY SHIPS WERE SENT TO HASTINGS TO ASSIST IN DEFENDING THE COAST AGAINST FRENCH INVASION. THE HARBOUR IS NOT HERE NOW, THE RIVER CHANGED COURSE AND THE NEAREST HARBOUR}NOW IS{NEWHAVEN. SEAFORD NEVER USED TO HAVE A{SEA {WALL}AND THE SEA USED TO{FLOOD}THE TOWN, WATER EVEN CAME UP CHURCH STREET! { }FIFTY YEARS AGO {BLATCHINGTON POND DRIED UP. CONSERVATIONISTS HAVE NOW LINED IT AND RESTOCKED IT. EARIER THIS CENTURY SEAFORD WAS KNOWN FOR ITS MANY{PRIVATE SCHOOLS. THERE WERE SPECIAL SHEDS AT THE STATION FOR THE TERMLY BAGGAGE.
